dt: {bc}the outer epithelial layer of the external integument of the animal body that is derived from the embryonic epiblast
{bc}the outer nonsensitive and nonvascular layer of the skin of a vertebrate that overlies the dermis
{bc}a thin surface layer of tissue in higher plants formed by growth of a primary meristem

et: Late Latin, from Greek, from {it}epi-{/it} + {it}derma{/it} skin {ma}{mat|derm-|}{/ma}
shortdef: the outer epithelial layer of the external integument of the animal body that is derived from the embryonic epiblast; specifically : the outer nonsensitive and nonvascular layer of the skin of a vertebrate that overlies the dermis
a thin surface layer of tissue in higher plants formed by growth of a primary meristem
